des:
Amazon Alexa is supported for Comfort Sync® A3 thermostats. With the Comfort Sync A3 supporting Alexa, you can now control the temperature in your home by simply using voice commands.

Getting started:
You will need to select ‘Enable skill’ in the Alexa app. This will allow you to link your Comfort Sync account with Alexa, and then discover your Comfort Sync A3 thermostat as well as any zoning sensors paired with your system. 
Find further information on connecting smart home devices like your Comfort Sync A3 at: http://amzn.to/291lR7u

Controlling your Comfort Sync A3 with Alexa:
You will need to tell Alexa which device you want to control. Please use the device name you see in your Devices list on the Alexa app.
There are two ways to define this/these name(s):
- Use the name(s) you set up already – these are shown on your Comfort Sync A3 thermostat and can be changed, or
- Create an Alexa group, like Bedroom or Downstairs, and add the thermostat and/or one or more zoning sensors to the group (find more information at: amzn.to/2965dCE).

 Example 1
 If you have the Comfort Sync A3 thermostat with the default system name, you can say:
- “Alexa, set Thermostat to 72 degrees.”
- “Alexa, what is the Thermostat set to?”
- “Alexa, increase Thermostat temperature.”

 Example 2
 If your Comfort Sync A3 thermostat is paired with Zoning sensors named “Bedroom”, “Upstairs” and “Living Room”, you can command Alexa to adjust your individual room temperatures by saying:
- “Alexa, set Bedroom to 72 degrees.”
- “Alexa, decrease Upstairs by 3 degrees.”
- “Alexa, what is the Living Room set to?”
-"Alexa, set Bedroom to ECO."
-"Alexa, set Upstairs to HEAT."
-“Alexa, set Living room to COOL."
-“Alexa, set Bedroom to AUTO."
-“Alexa, set Bedroom to OFF."

Note: It is suggested to use easy to recognize room names (like “Bedroom”, “Upstairs”, “Living room”).

Example 3:
Comfort Sync A3 thermostat "allows you to change the system mode" via Alexa voice command Supported System Modes: ‘HEAT’, ‘COOL’, ‘AUTO’, ‘ECO’, ‘OFF’
- “Alexa, set Thermostat to HEAT."
-“Alexa, set Thermostat to COOL.”
-“Alexa, set Thermostat to AUTO.”
-“Alexa, set Thermostat to ECO.”
-“Alexa, set Thermostat to OFF.”
